content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <codeBook xsi:schemaLocation="ddi:codebook:2_5 http://www.ddialliance.org/Specification/DDI-Codebook/2.5/XMLSchema/codebook.xsd" version="2.5" xmlns="ddi:codebook:2_5" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">   <docDscr>     <citation>       <titlStmt>         <titl>DDI2.5 XML CODEBOOK RECORD FOR STUDY NUMBER 851480</titl>       </titlStmt>       <prodStmt>         <prodDate></prodDate>       </prodStmt>     </citation>   </docDscr>   <stdyDscr>     <citation>       <titlStmt>         <titl>Geographies of missing people</titl>         <IDNo agency="UKDA">851480</IDNo>         <IDNo agency="datacite">10.5255/UKDA-SN-851480</IDNo>       </titlStmt>       <rspStmt>         <AuthEnty>H Parr, University of Glasgow</AuthEnty>       </rspStmt>       <prodStmt>         <copyright>Hester Parr, University of Glasgow</copyright>         <fundAg>Economic and Social Research Council</fundAg>         <grantNo>RES-062-23-2492</grantNo>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <depositr>H Parr, University of Glasgow</depositr>         <distDate date="2014-10-09T00:00:00Z">09 October 2014</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2015-01-07T00:00:00Z">Rvs41</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-851480" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>MISSING PEOPLE</keyword>         <keyword>2014</keyword>         <topcClas>Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This data collection represents the empirical materials collected from the ESRC project 'Geographies of Missing People'. It comprises 45 interviews with people previously reported as missing, 9 charity workers, 23 police officers of various ranks and 25 families of missing people.  We request that other researchers who wish to reuse our data get in touch to dialogue with the research team about how and why they want to reuse this data. The data is accessible with direct permission from the PI of the original ESRC award: Hester.parr@glasgow.ac.uk</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="2008-07-31T00:00:00Z">31 July 2008</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2013-12-31T00:00:00Z">31 December 2013</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="2011-01-31T00:00:00Z">31 January 2011</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2014-07-31T00:00:00Z">31 July 2014</collDate>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogCover>UK</geogCover>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>events and processes</anlyUnit>         <dataKind>Textual</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <collMode>Interviews and focus groups. Sampling methods are profiled in the main reports lodged on www.geographiesofmissingpeople.org.uk</collMode>         <sources />       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <contact><a href="mailto:Hester.parr@glasgow.ac.uk">H Parr, University of Glasgow</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat />   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
